instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED] No Back Light 820-3332 water dmg
threads.message: U9420 Had Corrosion. Notebook was not powering on after ultrasonic. Powers up no back light. No signs of corresion anywhere else. Pin 1 on connector looks red but soldered on c9000 is reading at 54v

threads.title: [SOLVED] No Back Light 820-3332 water dmg
threads.message: 54V means no connection to LEDs in LCD. Burned connector and/or cable is my 1st guess.

threads.title: [SOLVED] No Back Light 820-3332 water dmg
threads.message: Dont have this lcd im guessing next step order an lcd and try it out? Will a retina 13 lcd work i have those in stock? This is a 15 inch retina but connector looks the same.

threads.title: [SOLVED] No Back Light 820-3332 water dmg
threads.message: No needs to be 2012 15". Why don't check the connector, I bet the pin is burned.

threads.title: [SOLVED] No Back Light 820-3332 water dmg
threads.message: I Checked voltage on the connector. its 54v on pin one while turned on.

threads.title: [SOLVED] No Back Light 820-3332 water dmg
threads.message: then bad LCD cable or burned connector on LCD side. 54v means it does not see a load

threads.title: [SOLVED] No Back Light 820-3332 water dmg
threads.message: At this point you need a known good LCD. This is why you keep a few cracked but working assemblies for testing. Make sure the connector on the board is good before plugging in your good LCD or the cable may burn again.

threads.title: [SOLVED] No Back Light 820-3332 water dmg
threads.message: Ya i havent seen many retina 15s come through this shop! i think i woulda kept the lcds

threads.title: [SOLVED] No Back Light 820-3332 water dmg
threads.message: @Duke Hey been a little busy... Forgot to update so 54v on Pin 1 is no load detected from LED's This was the case as the new Retina display lit up perfectly!
